definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: The ritual vessels are one of important factors in the process of social civilization of Shandong Longshan Cuture.
sentences.chinese: 禮器是山東龍山文化文明化進程中的重要因素之一。

sentences.english: Brass drums are the Bouyei people's instruments of deity worshipping.
sentences.chinese: 銅鼓是布依族的神器禮器。

sentences.english: Jade wall is one of Chinese traditional ritual articles.
sentences.chinese: 玉璧是中國傳統禮器之一。

sentences.english: Jade Zhang was typical ritual utensil in Shu culture.
sentences.chinese: 玉璋是古蜀重要的祭祀禮器。

sentences.english: For such matters as ritual vessels, there are the functionaries.
sentences.chinese: 陳設禮器之類的事，自有有關人員照管。

sentences.english: The ritual and musical instruments in the Shang and Zhou period embodied the institution of rites and music.
sentences.chinese: 商周時期，禮器和樂器是禮樂制度的物化形態。

sentences.english: The second part, the analyse of the bronze sacrifice vessels of the central plains area in the Middle—Shang Period.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，中原地區商代中期青銅禮器的分析。

sentences.english: "Bi"is the valuable ritual vessels and another name for jade.
sentences.chinese: “璧”爲貴重禮器，也是美玉的通稱。

sentences.english: By the decoration of hoop, it seems to be a talisman ?
sentences.chinese: 看箍上的裝式，好像是個佛器，禮器？

sentences.english: Second is the sacrifice ceremony of the bronze sacrifice vessels unearthed from the hoard of bronze.
sentences.chinese: 二是青銅器窖藏中出土青銅禮器反映出的祭祀儀式。

definition: set of bells (old Chinese music instrument)
Han dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)/refers to the Western Han and Eastern Han
the Spring and Autumn (770-476 BC) and Warring States (475-221 BC) periods
the Song dynasty (960-1279)/refers to the Northern (960-1127) and Southern Song (1128-1279)

four divinities/four divine emperors/four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]/also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
